messages.message: I notice we are comparing our product to things like Textract and Document AI out of the box - I’m wondering if this is a fair comparison since technically Instabase as well cannot handle a random new document, and we need to write a Refiner program - does anyone know if Textract / Document AI can train on a set of docs -> goldens? / if we engaged with Google to apply Document AI to one of these forms through a POC, would the final result be similar in results?

@Aaron Vontell I'm not sure the exact answer to your PoC question but I do know Form Recognizer now has a supervised and unsupervised versions which (_I think)_ allows someone to train on a set of docs like you mentioned. Highly recommend checking out the demo recording if you haven't seen already
they're the bigger threat IMHO as they will soon (later this year) have capabilities to process invoices, receipts, bank statements OOTB like our solutions

@Aaron Vontell I don’t think I was comparing. I was just saying black-box ML techniques aren’t the right solution for extraction from high-variable docs (unless the target label is small and known in advance).
I think customers would have hard time getting FormRecognizer to work in a real production system for the reasons I mentioned (system complexity is not addressed there)
The demo was to demonstrate why these techniques won’t pose a competition — we just need to have the right narrative.
